did.unittitle: Metropolitan Christian Council of Philadelphia records

bioghist.p: The Metropolitan Christian Council of Philadelphia traces its roots back to the Sunday and Adult School Union, founded in Philadelphia in 1817. The organization has gone through several changes in name, scope, and mission. From 1824 to 1939, the organization was known as the American Sunday School Union; from 1939 to 1968, the Philadelphia Council of Churches; and since 1969 as the Metropolitan Christian Council of Philadelphia.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records of the Metropolitan Christian Council of Philadelphia. Materials include: reports, statements, long range planning documents, and histories of the Board of Directors, 1986-1998; Board of Directors minutes, 1969-1982 and 1986-1989; Executive committee minutes, 1968-1984; Bylaws and Executive Committee correspondence, 1965-1985; Philadelphia Council of Churches, Board of Directors minutes, 1939-1968.; Department of Research and Planning minutes, 1948-1968; minutes, constitution, and by-laws of the Delaware Valley Media Ministry, 1983-1999; Philadelphia Council of Churches scrapbook of clippings, 1918-1930; and copies of Connections newsletter, 1993-1999. The collection also includes subject files on a range of topics, including childcare, housing, health, homosexuality, abortion, youth employment, youth and crime, GRIT (Girl Renovators in Training), the Pentecost Festival, Delaware Valley Interfaith Coalition on Public Policy, MOVE, cults, lay ministry, hunger, small businesses, and the Ku Klux Klan.
